instruction: Given five words, construct a poem with a consistent meter.
output:
My foolish trespass did not bring me bliss 
My wisdom should have kept me from such risk 
My apology is more than a must
So, I pray for those I hurt, that our bonds rust

Trust can be built if I make amends
For my foolish choices and disrupt trends
Let my apologies be sincere 
Then trust and wisdom may reappear
